label: Bicycle network coverage
description: Bike lanes can improve bicyclist and pedestrian safety, physical activity, and sustainable transportation use. An increase in percentage of streets with bike lanes can indicate a safer cycling environment in a neighborhood which may increase overall cycling.

label: Sidewalk area
description: Sidewalks are important for commuting, businesses, and physical activity. Greater sidewalk area can contribute to a safer pedestrian environment, support vibrant business districts and can foster social interaction among residents.

label: Subway station density
description: Neighborhoods with greater subway access encourage active transportation, which may increase physical activity and overall health of residents. They also tend to have more foot traffic, which attracts businesses and can foster community.

label: Tree canopy cover
description: Tree canopy coverage is the percent of a neighborhood that is shaded by trees. Tree shade can lower a neighborhood's temperatures, can make it more comfortable and attractive to walk and stay active.

label: Unhealthy food access
description: A neighborhood's ratio of bodegas to supermarkets can indicate whether the environment makes accessing unhealthy food easier for residents, as bodegas are less likely to have healthy food options than supermarkets.

label: Grass and tree cover
description: Vegetative cover is the land covered by trees, grass, or other plants instead of a hard surface like roads, sidewalks, or buildings. Vegetative cover tends to reduce temperatures in the immediate area and may increase air quality.

label: Walkability index
description: This score summarizes features that promote walking, including density of residences, intersections, subway stops, and retail area. Higher scores indicate greater walkability. Neighborhoods range  from -4.0 to 9.4, with zero as an approximate NYC average. This indicator excludes some factors that may impact access and walkability, like maintenance, ADA access, neighborhood safety, and street trees.

label: Park access (walking distance)
description: The percentage of the population who live within walking distance to a park: a quarter-mile or less to entrances of smaller sites, such as sitting areas and playgrounds, and half-mile or less to entrances of larger parks. Increased access to green space and open space can contribute to increased levels of physical activity.

Indicator: Walking distance to a subway station
label: Subway access (walking distance)
description: The percentage of population within a quarter-mile of a subway station entrance. When more people have convenient access to the transit system, they're more likely to use it. Subway access encourages active transportation, which improves the health of residents.

label: Air quality action days
description: Action days for sensitive groups are counted when either ozone or PM2.5 levels are above 100, and for the general population when levels are above 150.

label: Black carbon
description: Black carbon is a major component of fine particles in the air. Fine particles are easily inhaled and contribute to both short-term acute health effects, as well as long-term chronic illness.

label: Fine particles (PM 2.5)
description: Fine particles are emitted by vehicles, building boilers, and other combustion - and are a major form of air pollution that harms health.

label: Fine particles (PM 2.5)
description: Fine particles are emitted by vehicles, building boilers, and other combustion - and are a major form of air pollution that harms health.

label: Nitric oxide (NOx)
description: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), including nitric oxide (NO) and nitrogen dioxide (NO2), are a group of pollutants formed by combusion that damage lung tissue, cause breathing problems, and contribute to smog and acid rain.

label: Nitrogen dioxide (NO2)
description: Nitrogen dioxide is a pollutant formed by combusion that damage lung tissue, cause breathing problems, and contribute to smog and acid rain.

label: Ozone
description: Ozone is a common air pollutant that can harm breathing and worsen asthma and other respiratory conditions.

label: Ozone (O3)
description: Ozone is a common air pollutant that can harm breathing and worsen asthma and other respiratory conditions.

label: Sulfur dioxide (SO2)
description: Sulfur dioxide comes from burning some kinds of fuel oil. As an air pollutant, it can can worsen lung diseases.

label: Alcohol access
description: Greater alcohol outlet density has been associated with a variety of health effects.

label: Alcohol access (youth)
description: Greater alcohol outlet density has been associated with a variety of health effects.

label: Heavy drinking (adults)
description: Heavy drinking is having more than 2 drinks per day (men) or more than 1 drink per day ( women).

label: Binge drinking (adults)
description: Binge drinking is having 5 or more drinks on one occasion, and as of 2011, 4 or more drinks for women.

label: Underage drinking
description: Public high school students who report having at least 1 drink in the past 30 days.

label: Binge drinking (youth)
description: Public high school students who reported having 5 or more drinks in a row in the past 30 days.

label: Adults with asthma
description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues  increase risk of  developing and triggering asthma.

label: Adults with asthma (past 12 months)
description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues  increase risk of  developing and triggering asthma.

label: Adults
description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.

Indicator: Asthma emegency department visits (adults), by NTA
label: Adults (by NTA)
description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.

Indicator: Asthma emergency department visits (age 4 and under)
label: Children (4 and under)
description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.

Indicator: Asthma emergency department visits (age 4 and under), by NTA
short_name: Asthma ED visits (age 4 and under), by NTA
label: Children (4 and under), by NTA
description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.

label: Children (age 5 to 17)
description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.

Indicator: Asthma emergency department visits (age 5 to 17), by NTA
short_name: Asthma ED visits (age 5 to 17), by NTA
label: Children (age 5 to 17), by NTA
description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.

label: Adults
description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

label: Adults (by NTA)
description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

label: Children (4 and under)
description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

label: Children (age 5 to 17)
description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

label: Children (age 5 to 17), by NTA
description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

label: Children with asthma
description: Children age 13 and under who have ever been diagnosed with asthma.

label: Jail Incarceration
description: Each component of the criminal justice continuum - from arrest to re-entry - carries various health consequences, and a growing body of literature has documented severe adverse health outcomes associated with incarceration on the individual, their families, and neighbourhoods.

("Structural Racism and Health Inequities in the USA: Evidence and Interventions”, by Zinzi D Bailey, ScD; Professor Nancy Krieger, PhD; Madina Agénor, ScD; Jasmine Graves, MPH; Natalia Linos, ScD; and Dr. Mary T. Bassett, MD)

Indicator: Asthma in public school children (age 5 to 14)
label: Asthma in public school children (age 5 to 14)
description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues  increase risk of  developing and triggering asthma.

Indicator: Persistent asthma in public school children (age 5 to 14)
label: Persistent asthma in public school children (age 5 to 14)
description: Persistent asthma is when symptom occur more than twice per week.

label: Youth asthma (past 12 months)
description: Public high school students who reported having an asthma attack in the past 12 months.

label: Homes with bed bugs
description: Estimated number of adults reporting a problem with bed bugs that required an exterminator, in the past 12 months.

label: Anencephaly
description: Anencephaly is a serious birth defect in which a baby is born without parts of the brain and skull.

Indicator: Cleft lip (with or without cleft palate)
label: Cleft lip (with or without cleft palate)
description: Cleft lip is a birth defect that occurs when a baby’s lip does not form properly during pregnancy.

label: Cleft palate (without cleft lip)
description: Cleft palate is a birth defect that occurs when a baby’s mouth does not form properly during pregnancy.

label: Down Syndrome (Mother under age 35)
description: Down syndrome is a condition in which a person has an extra chromosome. It causes delays in physical growth, and intellectual disabilities.

label: Down Syndrome (Mother age 35 and up)
description: Down syndrome is a condition in which a person has an extra chromosome. It causes delays in physical growth, and intellectual disabilities.

label: Gastroschisis
description: A birth defect where there is a hole beside the belly button and the baby’s intestines or other organs are outside the baby’s body.

label: Hypoplastic left heart syndrome
description: A rare birth defect where part of the heart is underdeveloped.

label: Hypospadias
description: A birth defect in male babies where the urethra opening is not at the tip of the penis.

label: Lower limb Deficiencies
description: Lower limb deficiencies include undergrowth, overgrowth, failure of formation, and other variations or deficiencies in the lower limbs.

label: Spina bifida (without anencephaly)
description: Spina bifida is a neural tube defect that can cause cause physical and intellectual disabilities.

label: Tetralogy of Fallot
description: Tetralogy of Fallot is a congenital heart defect that affects how blood flows through the heart.

label: Transposition of the great arteries (vessels)
description: Transposition of the great arteries or vessels is a congenital heart defect that involves abnormal arrangement of parts of the heart.

label: Upper limb deficiencies
description: Upper limb deficiencies include undergrowth, overgrowth, failure of formation, and other variations or deficiencies in the upper limbs.

label: Death (infants)
description: Death among children under 1 year old.

label: Low birthweight at full term
description: Low birth weight is when a baby weighs less than 5 lbs, 8 oz at full term.

label: Death (neonatal)
description: Deaths among children less than 28 days old.

label: Death (perinatal)
description: Deaths from 28 weeks of preganancy to 6 days old.

label: Death (postneonatal)
description: Deaths from 28 days old to 1 year old.

label: Preterm birth
description: Birth at fewer than 37 weeks gestational age.

label: Sex ratio
description: The ratio of male to female births.

label: Total lifetime fertility
description: A measure of total birth rate, expressed as the number of children per 1,000 women.

label: Very low birthweight
description: Very low birth weight is when a baby weighs less than 3 lbs, 5 oz.

label: Very preterm birth
description: Birth at fewer than 32 weeks gestational age.

label: Acute myeloid leukemia
description: Acute myeloid leukemia is a cancer of the blood and bone marrow.

label: Bladder cancer
description: Bladder cancer is a common type of cancer. It typically affects older adults.

Indicator: Brain and other nervous system cancer
short_name: Brain and other nervous system cancer
label: Brain and other nervous system cancer
description: Brain and other nervous system cancers are tumors that start in the brain or spinal cord.

label: Breast cancer (in females)
description: Breast cancer is a common cancer. It is more common among females.

label: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia
description: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) is a cancer that starts from white blood cells in bone marrow.

label: Esophageal cancer
description: Esophageal cancer forms in the tissues of the esophagus, in the throat.

label: Kidney and renal pelvis cancer
description: Kidney and renal pelvis cancers start in the kidney.

label: Larynx cancer
description: Larynx cancer starts in the tissues of the larynx.

label: Leukemia
description: Leukemia is a general term for cancer of blood cells.

Indicator: Liver and intrahepatic bile duct cancer
short_name: Liver and intrahepatic bile duct cancer
label: Liver and intrahepatic bile duct cancer
description: Cancers of the liver and intrahepatic bile duct.

label: Lung and bronchus cancer
description: Cancers in the lung or bronchus.

label: Melanoma of the skin
description: A dangerous form of skin cancer.

label: Mesothelioma
description: A cancer caused by exposure to asbestos.

label: Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas
description: A cancer that starts in the lymphatic system, part of the body's immune system.

label: Oral cavity and pharynx cancer
description: Cancers of the mouth and throat.

label: Pancreatic cancer
description: Cancer of the pancreas.

label: Thyroid cancer
description: Cancer of the thyroid, a gland in the neck.

label: Acute lymphocytic leukemia (children)
description: A cancer of the blood and bone marrow.

label: Acute myeloid leukemia (children)
description: A cancer of the blood and bone marrow.

Indicator: Brain and other nervous system cancer (children)
short_name: Brain and other nervous system cancer (children)
label: Brain and other nervous system cancer (children)
description: Brain and other nervous system cancers are tumors that start in the brain or spinal cord.

label: Leukemia (children)
description: Leukemia is a general term for cancer of blood cells.

label: All cancer (children)
description: A group of diseases where cells grow abnormally.

label: Carbon monoxide emergency department visits
description: Carbon monoxide exposure can be life-threatening or fatal. ED visits and hospitalizations allows us to understand the burden of CO-related health impacts.

label: Carbon monoxide hospitalizations
description: Carbon monoxide exposure can be life-threatening or fatal. ED visits and hospitalizations allows us to understand the burden of CO-related health impacts.

label: Carbon monoxide incidents
description: A carbon monoxide incident is a leak where the Fire Department measures at least 1 ppm at the scene.

label: Carbon monoxide incidents (without a detector)
description: Carbon monoxide detectors are required in NYC homes by law. Failure to provide or maintain a detector can put people at risk for carbon monoxide poisoning and death.

label: Carbon monoxide deaths
description: A death due to carbon monoxide may be fire-related or non-fire-related.

label: Carbon monoxide emergency department visits
description: Carbon monoxide exposure can be life-threatening or fatal. ED visits and hospitalizations allows us to understand the burden of CO-related health impacts.

label: Carbon monoxide hospitalizations
description: Carbon monoxide exposure can be life-threatening or fatal. ED visits and hospitalizations allows us to understand the burden of CO-related health impacts.

label: Lead testing (by age 3)
description: In New York State, all children must be tested for lead before age 3. There is no safe level of lead in the blood.

label: Elevated blood levels (under age 6)
description: Elevated blood lead levels are 5+ mcg/dL. There is no safe level of lead in the blood. Lead poisoning can cause learning and behavior problems, and delay growth and mental development.

Indicator: Elevated blood levels (under age 6), by NTA
label: Elevated blood levels (under age 6), by NTA
description: Elevated blood lead levels are 5+ mcg/dL. There is no safe level of lead in the blood. Lead poisoning can cause learning and behavior problems, and delay growth and mental development.

Indicator: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Emergency Department Visits
label: Emergency Department Visits
Secondhand smoke at home
description: Adults reporting secondhand smoke at home. Secondhand smoke, especially indoors, is bad for health - especially for the health of children.

Indicator: Secondhand smoke at home (from outside sources)
label: Secondhand smoke at home (from outside sources)
description: Adults reporting secondhand smoke at home, from outside sources. Secondhand smoke, especially indoors, is bad for health - especially for the health of children.

label: Secondhand smoke at work
description: Adults reporting secondhand smoke at work. Secondhand smoke, especially indoors, is bad for health.

label: No smoke-free home policy
description: Adults without a smoke-free home policy. A smoke-free home policy can limit people's exposure to secondhand smoke, which is especially dangerous to children.

label: Cigarette smoking (adults)
description: Cigarette smoking is the leading cause of preventable deaths in the USA. It causes many diseases and greatly harms health.

label: Cigarette smoking (youths)
description: Cigarette smoking is the leading cause of preventable deaths in the USA. It causes many diseases and greatly harms health.

label: Air Quality Advisory Days
description: During Air Quality Action Days, some people may experience health effects such as coughing, irritation in your throat, asthma complications or other respiratory issues. Sensitive populations may experience more serious health effects and should take actions to protect their health.

label: Fine Particulate Matter (PM <sub>2.5</sub>)
description: During Air Quality Action Days, some people may experience health effects such as coughing, irritation in your throat, asthma complications or other respiratory issues. Sensitive populations may experience more serious health effects and should take actions to protect their health.

label: Ozone
description: During Air Quality Action Days, some people may experience health effects such as coughing, irritation in your throat, asthma complications or other respiratory issues. Sensitive populations may experience more serious health effects and should take actions to protect their health.

label: Older adults with air conditioners (age 65+)
description: Older adults (over 65) are more vulnerable to hot weather and heat stress. Air conditioning reduces the risk of heat stroke and other heat-related illness.

label: Adults with air conditioners
description: Adults reporting having an air conditioner. Air conditioning reduces the risk of heat stroke and other heat-related illness.

label: Daytime summer surface temperature
description: Surface temperatures vary based on vegetative cover (which promotes cooling), as well as by materials that retain heat (like paved roads, sidewalks, and buildings). Hotter neighborhoods tend to have more heat-exacerbated deaths associated with extreme heat events.

label: Heat events
description: Heat events threaten health. More people die due to extreme heat than all other extreme weather events combined. As the climate continues to warm, we can expect more severe and more frequent heat events.

label: Heat vulnerability index
description: The HVI shows the risk of community-level heat impacts, like deaths, due to extreme heat events. It is made up of data on surface temperature, green space, air conditioning access, poverty, and Black population (the population most excluded from heat resources). Differences in community-level heat impacts stem from structural racism, which limits access to preventive resources.

label: Heat vulnerability index (NTA)
description: The HVI shows the risk of community-level heat impacts, like deaths, due to extreme heat events. It is made up of data on surface temperature, green space, air conditioning access, poverty, and Black population (the population most excluded from heat resources). Differences in community-level heat impacts stem from structural racism, which limits access to preventive resources.

label: Household air conditioning
description: Air conditioning is an important way to avoid heat stress, especially for persons with limited mobility.

label: Households using electric medical equipment
description: People who use electric medical equipment are more vulnerable during power outages or evacuations.

label: Vegetative cover
description: Vegetative cover is the land covered by trees, grass, or other plants. Vegetative cover tends to reduce temperatures in the immediate area.

Indicator: Adults Reporting Cockroaches in the Home
label: Adults reporting cockroaches in the home

Indicator: Children living in homes with cockroaches (ages 0-13 years)
label: Children living in homes with cockroaches (ages 0-13 years)
Homes with cockroaches
description: The saliva, feces, and shedding body parts of cockroaches are an allergen and can trigger asthma.

Subtopic: Diabetes, High Blood Pressure and High Cholesterol
label: Adults with Diabetes

Subtopic: Diabetes, High Blood Pressure and High Cholesterol
label: Adults with High Blood Pressure

Subtopic: Diabetes, High Blood Pressure and High Cholesterol
label: Adults with High Cholesterol
Disinfection By-Product in Drinking Water - Haloacetic Acids (HAA5)
Disinfection By-Product in Drinking Water - Total Trihalomethanes (TTHM)

Indicator: Fall-related emergency department visits among older adults
label: Fall-related emergency department visits among older adults

Indicator: Home fall-related emergency department visits among older adults
label: Home fall-related emergency department visits among older adults

Indicator: Home fall-related hospitalizations among older adults
label: Home fall-related hospitalizations among older adults

Indicator: Homes with reported falls among adults 65 and older
label: Homes with reported falls among adults 65 and older
Adults with Health Insurance
description: Health insurance coverage is associated with numerous beneficial health effects. Those with health insurance are more likely to have a regular doctor, receive preventive care services, better manage chronic health conditions, have longer life expectancy, and more.

Indicator: Households that postponed health care in the last 12 months
label: Households that postponed health care in the last 12 months
Premature Mortality
description: The rate of people who die before age 65 can indicate the overall health of a population.

Indicator: Asthma ED visits due to Ozone
label: Asthma ED visits due to Ozone
description: Ozone can cause asthma ED visits, which are part of the health burden of  air pollution.

label: Asthma hospitalizations due to Ozone
description: Ozone can cause hospitalizations for asthma, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.

Indicator: Cardiac and respiratory deaths due to Ozone
label: Cardiac and respiratory deaths due to Ozone
description: Estimating heart and respiratory deaths that can be linked to ozone is a way to understand how air pollution increases mortality.

Indicator: Asthma ED visits due to PM2.5
label: Asthma ED visits due to PM2.5
description: PM2.5 can cause asthma ED visits, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.

label: Cardiovascular hospitalizations due to PM2.5 (age 40+)
description: PM2.5 can cause cardiovascular hospitalizations, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.

label: Deaths due to PM2.5
description: Estimating deaths that can be linked to PM2.5 is a way to understand how air pollution increases mortality.

label: Respiratory hospitalizations due to PM2.5 (age 20+)
description: Estimating hospitalizations that can be linked to PM2.5 is a way to understand how air pollution impacts public health.

Indicator: Adult Consumption of 1 or More Sugary Drinks Per Day
label: Adult Consumption of 1 or More Sugary Drinks Per Day

Indicator: Youth Consumption of 1 or More Sugary Drinks Per Day
label: Youth Consumption of 1 or More Sugary Drinks Per Day
Heart Attack Hospitalizations
description: Heart attacks can stem from genetic, lifestyle, and environmental factors including ambient air pollution and second-hand smoke.

label: Mold in homes
description: Adults reporting mold in the home. Mold can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma, and indicate maintenance deficiencies in a building.

label: Secondhand smoke at home
description: Adults reporting secondhand smoke at home. Secondhand smoke, especially indoors, is bad for health - especially for the health of children.

Indicator: Children in homes with supplemental heat (age 13 and under)
label: Children in homes with supplemental heat (age 13 and under)
description: The need for supplemental heat may mean a building's main heat source doesn't work - and can indicate the presence of other health-threatening maintenance deficiencies, which can harm children's health.

Indicator: Children in homes with cockroaches (age 13 and under)
label: Children in homes with cockroaches (age 13 and under)
description: The saliva, feces, and shedding body parts of cockroaches are an allergen and can trigger asthma - which is a special concern for children's health.

Indicator: Children in homes with cracks or holes (age 13 and under)
label: Children in homes with cracks or holes (age 13 and under)
description: Cracks or holes are a maintenance deficiency linked to the presence of mice, rats, and cockroaches - which can harm children's health.

Indicator: Children in homes with mice (age 13 and under)
label: Children in homes with mice (age 13 and under)
description: The presence of mice or rats in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. These pests can contaminate food and worsen asthma.

label: Evictions (court-ordered)
description: Eviction often leads to residential instability, moving into poor quality housing, overcrowding, and homelessness, all of which is associated with negative health among adults and children.People who are threatened with eviction, even before they lose their home, are more likely to report poor health, high blood pressure, depression  (from "The Hidden Health Crisis of Eviction" by Allison Bovell-Ammo and Megan Sandel).

label: Household crowding
description: Households with more than one person per room are considered crowded.

Indicator: Homes near structures rated good or excellent
label: Homes near structures rated good or excellent
description: Building quality predicts the number of housing maintenance deficiencies in a residence that place residents at increased risk of acute or chronic health problems.

label: Homes using supplemental heat
description: The need for supplemental heat may mean a building's main heat source doesn't work - and can indicate the presence of other health-threatening maintenance deficiencies.

label: Homes with 3 or more maintenance deficiencies
description: Homes with maintenance deficiencies can threaten the health of the people who live there.

label: Homes with cockroaches
description: The saliva, feces, and shedding body parts of cockroaches are an allergen and can trigger asthma.

label: Homes with cracks or holes
description: Cracks or holes are a maintenance deficiency linked to the presence of mice, rats, and cockroaches - which can harm residents' health.

Indicator: Homes with grab bars in bathroom (among older adult households)
label: Homes with grab bars in bathroom (among older adult households)
description: Grab bars in bathrooms can help prevent falls among older adults.

label: Homes with leaks
description: Leaks are a maintenance deficiency that can harm health by introducing mold, which can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma.

Indicator: Homes with mice or rats in the building
label: Homes with mice or rats in the building
description: The presence of mice or rats in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. These pests can contaminate food and worsen asthma.

label: Households reporting air conditioning
description: Air conditioning is an important way to avoid heat stress, especially for persons with limited mobility.

label: Households using electric medical equipment
description: People who use electric medical equipment are more vulnerable during power outages or evacuations.

label: Old homes with peeling paint
description: Older housing (built before 1960) and peeling paint can put residents at risk of lead poisoning, due to lead paint - which was banned from household paints in the USA in 1978.

Indicator: Renter-occupied homes with any health-related maintenance problems
label: Renter-occupied homes with any health-related maintenance problems
description: Homes with maintenance deficiencies can threaten the health of the people who live there.

Indicator: Renter-occupied homes with no maintenance deficiencies
label: Renter-occupied homes with no maintenance deficiencies
description: Healthy homes are free of maintenance deficiencies.

Indicator: Children under 5 years old in Poverty
label: Children under 5 years old in Poverty
description: Poverty is a major determinant of health, since poverty deprives people of access to health and safety resources.

label: Pre-1960 Homes with Peeling Paint
description: Older housing and peeling paint can put residents at risk of lead poisoning, due to lead paint - which was banned from household paints in the USA in 1978.

Indicator: Adults Reporting Mice in the Home
label: Adults reporting mice in the home
description: Mice or rats in the home are a source of household allergens connected to the developement of asthma and exacerbation of asthma symptoms. They may also indicate other health-threatening maintenance deficiencies.

Indicator: Adults Reporting Rats or Mice outside Their Building
label: Adults reporting rats or mice outside their building
description: Mice and rats outside a building can indicate the presence of mice and rats in people's homes - which can trigger asthma and indicate other health-threatening maintenance deficiencies.

Indicator: Children living in homes with mice (ages 0-13  years)
label: Children living in homes with mice (ages 0-13  years)

Indicator: Homes with Mice or Rats in the Building
label: Homes with mice or rats in the building
description: The presence of mice or rats in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. These pests can contaminate food and contribute to the development and exacerbation of asthma and its symptoms.

label: Premature Mortality
description: The rate of people who die before age 65 can indicate the overall health of a population.

label: Black Carbon
description: Black carbon is a major component of fine particulate matter (PM) in the air. Particulate matter is easily inhaled into the lungs and can contribute to both short-term acute health effects, as well as long-term chronic illness.

label: Fine Particulate Matter (PM<sub>2.5</sub>)
description: Fine particles are emitted by vehicles, building boilers, and other combustion - and are a major form of air pollution that harms health.

label: Nitric Oxide (NO)
description: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), which include nitric oxide (NO) and nitrogen dioxide (NO2), are a group of pollutants formed by combusion that can cause damage to lung tissue, breathing and respiratory problems, as well as contribute to smog and acid rain.

label: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2)
description: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), which include nitric oxide (NO) and nitrogen dioxide (NO2), are a group of pollutants formed by combusion that can cause damage to lung tissue, breathing and respiratory problems, as well as contribute to smog and acid rain.

label: Ozone (O3)
description: Ozone is a common air pollutant that can harm breathing and worsen asthma and other respiratory conditions.

label: Sulfur Dioxide (SO2)
description: Sulfur dioxide comes from burning certain types of fuel oil. As an air pollutant, it can can worsen lung diseases.

Indicator: All Agency Use of "Best Practice" Products
label: All NYC Agencies

Indicator: Adults Reporting Personal Use of Pesticides
label: Adults Reporting Personal Pesticide Use
Adults with Independent Living Difficulty
description: People with disabilities or access or functional needs may need additional support during extreme weather to avoid injury, illness or even death. For example, planning needs to be made for safe travel out of evacuation zones during a hurricane, or to ensure back-up electricity is available to to support medical equipment during power outages caused by heat waves.

Information provided here about adults with independent living difficulties can help emergency management professionals better prepare our residents for emergencies. For more information, please visit:
NYC Emergency Management: Disabilities, Access & Functional Needs

Indicator: Air Toxics Concentrations- Average Benzene Concentrations
label: Air Toxics Concentrations- Average Benzene Concentrations
description: Benzene is an air pollutant resulting from motor vehicle and industrial emissions and tobacco smoke. Benzene is a known carcinogen that can also harm bone marrow and red blood cell function.

Indicator: Air Toxics Concentrations- Average Formaldehyde Concentrations
label: Air Toxics Concentrations- Average Formaldehyde Concentrations
description: Formaldehyde is an air pollutant resulting from car exhaust and the manufacture of industrial products. Formaldehyde is a known carcinogen that can also cause irritation to eyes and lungs and increase risk of asthma and trigger asthma symptoms.

label: Area in hurricane evacuation zone
description: Areas in evacuation zones are at increased risk of flooding during coastal storms. They may be ordered to evacuate in the event of a hurricane or coastal flooding.

Indicator: Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Children 0 to 4 Yrs Old) by NTA
label: Children ages 0 to 4 - small area neighborhood (NTA)
Boiler Emissions- Total NOx Emissions
description: Boilers are a common source of NOx emissions, which can harm health.

label: Boiler Emissions- Total PM2.5 Emissions
description: Boilers are a common source of PM2.5, which can harm health.

label: Boiler Emissions- Total SO2 Emissions
description: Boilers are a common source of SO2, which can worsen lung disease.

label: Carbon monoxide incidents
description: A carbon monoxide incident is a leak where the Fire Department measures at least 1 ppm at the scene.

label: Court-Ordered Evictions
description: People who are threatened with eviction, even before they lose their home, are more likely to report poor health, high blood pressure, depression, anxiety, and psychological distress. Eviction often leads to residential instability, moving into poor quality housing, overcrowding, and homelessness, all of which is associated with negative health among adults and children.
(From "The Hidden Health Crisis of Eviction" by Allison Bovell-Ammo and Megan Sandel)

label: Crowding (> 1 person/room)
description: Occupied housing units with more than one person per room are considered crowded.

label: Disinfection By-Product in Drinking Water - Haloacetic Acids (HAA5)
Neighborhood Poverty (ACS)
description: Neighborhood poverty measures residents' access to economic stability, education, adequate health care, safe housing and freedom from stress. Neighborhoods with higher poverty tend to have less access to these factors and experience worse health outcomes.

label: Older adults living alone
description: Older adults are more vulnerable to extreme weather. Those living alone may have more difficulty getting resources they need in an emergency, and are at higher risk of weather-related illnesses like heat stroke and hypothermia.

label: Poverty
description: Neighborhood poverty is a major determinant of health, since poverty deprives people of access to health and safety resources.

Indicator: Public School Children (5-14 Yrs Old) with Asthma
label: Public school children (age 5-14) with asthma
description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Environmental exposures resulting from poor air quality and housing maintenance are known to increase risk of asthma development and trigger asthma symptoms.

Indicator: Public School Children (5-14 Yrs Old) with Persistent Asthma
label: Public school children (age 5-14) with persistent asthma
Serious psychological distress
description: Mental health conditions like series psychological distress can be worsened by extreme weather such as heat waves and coastal storms.

label: Sulfur Dioxide (SO2)
description: Sulfur dioxide comes from burning certain types of fuel oil. As an air pollutant, it can can worsen lung diseases.

Indicator: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled
label: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled
description: Traffic density is a measure of  the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.

Indicator: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled for Cars
label: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled for Cars
description: Traffic density is a measure of  the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.

Indicator: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled for Trucks
label: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled for Trucks
description: Traffic density is a measure of  the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.

label: Tree Canopy Cover
description: The number of trees and the area shaded by them influences many neighborhood factors, such as attractiveness and lower summer temperatures that, in turn, encourage residents and visitors to walk and do other physical activity. “Tree canopy cover” measures the percent of a neighborhood that is covered (or shaded) by trees.

label: Vegetative Cover
description: Vegetative cover is the land covered by trees, grass, or other plants. This area is not covered by a hard surface such as paved roads, sidewalks, or buildings. Vegetative cover tends to reduce temperatures in the immediate area.

label: Obese Adults
description: People who are obese are at increased risk for heart disease and diabetes. Neighborhood factors such as walkability and the types of food retail outlets available can impact residents' risk of being overweight or obese.

label: Overweight or Obese Adults
description: People who are overweight or obese are at increased risk for heart disease and diabetes.

Indicator: Adults Reporting Personal Use of Pesticides
label: Adults Reporting Personal Pesticide Use

Indicator: NYC Agency Use of "Best Practice" Products
label: "Best Practice" Products
description: NYC enacted a local law in 2005 that requires city agencies to reduce use of toxic products to control pests, and to adopt “Best Practices” instead. Best practice products use active ingredients with very low toxicity or involve formulation or application methods that minimize potential exposure and environmental spread.

Indicator: NYC Agency Use of Mosquito Control
label: Mosquito Control

Indicator: Adults Reporting Exercise in the Past 30 Days
label: Adults Reporting Exercise in the Past 30 Days
description: Regular exercise is a key way to stay healthy.

Indicator: Adults Who Walk or Bike for Transportation
label: Adults Who Walk or Bike for Transportation

Indicator: Bike for Transportation in the Past 7 Days
label: Bike for Transportation in the Past 7 Days
Monthly Bicycle Use
description: Monthly bicycle use is an indicator of physical activity and regular cycling.

Indicator: Walk for Transportation in the Past 7 Days
label: Walk for Transportation in the Past 7 Days
Adults with Health Insurance
description: Health insurance coverage is associated with numerous beneficial health effects. Those with health insurance are more likely to have a regular doctor, receive preventive care services, better manage chronic health conditions, have longer life expectancy, and more.

label: Adults with independent living difficulty
description: People with disabilities or access or functional needs may need additional support during extreme weather. For example, they may need extra planning for safe travel out of evacuation zones during a hurricane, or  back-up electricity  to support medical equipment during power outages.

Information provided here about adults with independent living difficulties can help emergency management professionals better prepare our residents for emergencies. For more information, please visit:
NYC Emergency Management: Disabilities, Access & Functional Needs

Indicator: Children under 5 years old in Poverty
label: Children under 5 years old in Poverty
description: Poverty is a major determinant of health, since poverty deprives people of access to health and safety resources.

label: Court-Ordered Evictions
description: People who are threatened with eviction, even before they lose their home, are more likely to report poor health, high blood pressure, depression, anxiety, and psychological distress. Eviction often leads to residential instability, moving into poor quality housing, overcrowding, and homelessness, all of which is associated with negative health among adults and children.
(From "The Hidden Health Crisis of Eviction" by Allison Bovell-Ammo and Megan Sandel)

label: Crowding (> 1 person/room)
description: Occupied housing units with more than one person per room are considered crowded.

label: Older Adults Living Alone
description: Adults over the age of 65 are more vulnerable to extreme hot and cold weather. Those that live alone may have more difficulty getting the resources they need in extreme weather events and are at higher risk of weather-related illnesses like heat stroke and hypothermia.

label: Perception of Neighborhood Safety
description: Whether people perceive their neighborhood as safe can affect whether they will spend time outside, use parks, and use active and sustainable forms of transportation. It can also affect mental well-being.

label: Neighborhood poverty
description: The percent of households with incomes below the federal poverty level. Households without sufficient resources are often deprived of access to items such as health care and good quality housing that are needed to maintain good health.

Indicator: Adult Consumption of 1 or More Sugary Drinks Per Day
label: Adult Consumption of 1 or More Sugary Drinks Per Day

Indicator: Youth Consumption of 1 or More Sugary Drinks Per Day
label: Youth Consumption of 1 or More Sugary Drinks Per Day

label: Adults Reporting Messaging While Driving in the Last 30 Days

label: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled
description: Traffic density is a measure of  the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.

Indicator: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled for Cars
label: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled for Cars
description: Traffic density is a measure of  the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.

Indicator: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled for Trucks
label: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled for Trucks
description: Traffic density is a measure of  the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.

label: Bicycle Network Coverage
description: The percent of streets with bike lanes can affect cyclist and pedestrian safety, physical activity, and sustainable transportation use.

Indicator: Modal Shift - Travel to the Central Business District
label: Modal Shift - Travel to the Central Business District
Bicycle Injury Emergency Department Visits
description: Bicycle injury ED visits can indicate the overall safety of cycling in the city - for transporation or other purposes.

label: Pedestrian Injury Emergency Department Visits
description: Pedestrian injury ED visits can indicate the safety of walking for transporation.

label: Babesiosis
description: Babesiosis is a rare, sometimes severe or fatal tick-borne disease caused by Babesia microti, a protozoan parasite that infects red blood cells. Babesiosis is transmitted by the bite of an infected blacklegged tick, Ixodes scapularis, the same tick that transmits Lyme disease and anaplasmosis.  Most patients acquire this disease while traveling to endemic areas outside NYC. However, there has been an increase in the number of cases with no history of travel to endemic areas, primarily in Staten Island, as well as isolated cases in the Bronx and Queens. Babesiosis can also be transmitted through transfused blood products.
For more information
NYC DOHMH Babesiosis Page
NYC DOHMH Zoonotic and Vector-borne Diseases
CDC Babesiosis
National Surveillance Babesiosis Case Definition

label: West Nile virus
description: West Nile virus (WNV) is an arbovirus which is transmitted through the bite of infected mosquitoes; in NYC, the mosquitoes that transmit WNV are primarily Culex pipiens as well as Culex restuans and Culex salinarius. While most people who are infected will not go on to develop symptoms, about 20% can experience mild or moderate illness and more rarely, neuroinvasive disease which can present as encephalitis or meningitis.  Most of the West Nile disease cases detected by the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene represent neuroinvasive disease as these patients are more likely to seek care.   More specific West Nile viral disease data is available on the Health Department website.

label: Non-fatal Assault Emergency Department Visits
description: Violence is frequently described through homicide statistics. While it is a leading cause of death and captures the most severe form of violence, non-fatal violence-related injuries resulting in emergency department visits are much more common and help paint the larger picture on the burden of violence and its impact on the health and future of individuals, families, and communities.

label: Non-fatal Assault Hospitalizations
description: Violence is frequently described through homicide statistics. While it is a leading cause of death and captures the most severe form of violence, non-fatal violence-related injuries resulting in hospitalizations are much more common and help paint the larger picture on the burden of violence and its impact on the health and future of individuals, families, and communities.

Monthly Bicycle Use
description: Monthly bicycle use is an indicator of physical activity and regular cycling.

label: Walk for Transportation in the Past 7 Days
Heat stress: hospitalizations
description: Heat stress hospitalizations weather are part of the public health burden due to hot weather. Data aggregated over five years provides enough stablility to display neighborhood impacts.

label: Cold stress: deaths
description: Deaths due to cold weather represent part of the public health burden of cold weather. Cold weather can also worsen chronic conditions, sometimes leading to death. This data only includes deaths directly attributed to cold on death certificates.

label: Cold stress: emergency department visits
description: ED visits for cold-related illnesses, such as hypothermia and frostbite, represent part of the public health burden of cold weather. Cold weather can also make chronic conditions worse.

label: Cold stress: hospitalizations
description: Hospitalizations for cold-related illnesses, such as hypothermia and frostbite, represent part of the public health burden of cold weather. Cold weather can also make chronic conditions worse.

label: Heat events
description: Heat events threaten health. More people die due to extreme heat than all other extreme weather events combined. As the climate continues to warm, we can expect more severe and more frequent heat events.

label: Heat stress: deaths
description: Hot weather kills more people than all other extreme weather combined. This measure includes only deaths directly attributed to heat on death certificates, which represent a small proportion of all heat-related deaths.

label: Heat stress: emergency department visits
description: ED visits due to heat-related illnesses, such as heat stroke and heat exhaustion, represent part of the public health burden of extreme heat.

label: Heat stress: hospitalizations
description: Heat stress hospitalizations due to heat-related illnesses, such as heat stroke and heat exhaustion, represent part of the public health burden of hot weather. Data aggregated over five years provides enough stability to display neighborhood impacts.

label: Heat vulnerability index
description: The HVI shows differences in community-level heat mortality impacts due to extreme heat events. It includes data on surface temperature, green space, air conditioning access, poverty, and the percent of Black New Yorkers, who are most excluded from heat resources. Differences in community-level heat impacts by race stem from structural racism, which limits access to preventive resources.

Indicator: Heat vulnerability index by neighborhood tabulation area (NTA)
label: Heat vulnerability index by neighborhood tabulation area (NTA)
description: The HVI shows differences in community-level heat mortality impacts due to extreme heat events. It includes data on surface temperature, green space, air conditioning access, poverty, and the percent of Black New Yorkers, who are most excluded from heat resources. Differences in community-level heat impacts by race stem from structural racism, which limits access to preventive resources.

Indicator: Elevated Blood Lead Levels among Persons Aged 16 or Older
label: Elevated Blood Lead Levels among  Persons Aged 16 or Older
description: In New York City, the most common cause of lead poisoning in non-pregnant adults is from occupational exposure in the construction industry. Workers are exposed by breathing in or ingesting lead dust or fumes during renovations, repairs and demolitions that disturb old, lead based paint. Workers in other industries, as well as hobbyists, may be at risk if they work with lead-containing metal, paint, pigments, ceramic glazes or bullets. Adults can also be exposed to lead through the use of lead-contaminated products, such as certain imported health remedies or medicines, spices, foods, pottery and cosmetics.

label: Hospitalizations Billed to Workers’ Compensation
description: Workers’ compensation is a type of insurance that provides medical care for workers who are injured or become ill as a direct result of their job. Hospitalizations billed to workers' compensation represent only a portion of work-related injuries that require hospital care. It is important to realize that workers’ compensation policies vary from state-to-state with respect to the types of workers covered and the types of injuries and illnesses eligible for compensation.

label: Hospitalizations for Asbestosis
description: Asbestos is a naturally-occurring mineral which was commonly used as an insulation material until the 1970s. Inhaling high concentrations of asbestos fibers over a long time can produce lung inflammation and scarring resulting in the chronic lung disease called asbestosis, a type of pneumoconiosis. New York City construction, insulation, and shipyard workers who installed, disturbed, or removed asbestos without respiratory protection are at risk. Additionally, smokers who are exposed to asbestos have a greater risk of developing asbestos-related diseases than non-smokers.

Typically it takes more than ten years from the time of exposure before symptoms develop. The use of proper protective masks is key to preventing the disease, since there is no treatment for this condition.

label: Hospitalizations for Pneumoconiosis
description: Pneumoconiosis is a general term given to any lung disease caused by breathing in certain particles or fibers over a prolonged period. Pneumoconiosis usually results from a workplace exposure  The most common causes of pneumoconiosis include asbestos fibers (asbestosis), silica dust (silicosis), and coal dust (coal workers’ pneumoconiosis or “Black Lung Disease”). There is no cure, but it can be prevented with appropriate respiratory protection.

label: Perception of Neighborhood Safety
description: Whether people perceive their neighborhood as safe can affect whether they will spend time outside, use parks, and use active and sustainable forms of transportation. It can also affect mental well-being.

label: Work-Related Deaths across All Industries
description: Fatal work-related injuries include deaths resulting from unintentional injuries such as falls, acute poisonings, and motor vehicle crashes that occur during travel for work, and intentional injuries (i.e., homicides and suicides) that occur at work. Fatal injuries that occur during a person’s commute to or from work are not included.

Data on work-related deaths are compiled by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) Census of Fatal Occupational Injuries (CFOI). CFOI produces statistics on fatal work-related injuries by cross-referencing multiple sources, such as death certificates, workers' compensation reports, and Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) investigation reports.

Indicator: Work-Related Deaths in the Construction Industry by Borough
label: Work-Related Deaths in the Construction Industry by Borough of Injury.
description: The New York City workforce is a diverse one and workplace risks are not distributed equally. Construction is the most dangerous industry in NYC, accounting for nearly a third of work-related injury deaths each year.

Indicator: Work-Related Deaths in the Construction Industry Citywide
label: Work-Related Deaths in the Construction Industry Citywide
description: The New York City workforce is a diverse one and workplace risks are not distributed equally. Construction is the most dangerous industry in NYC, accounting for nearly a third of work-related injury deaths each year. Falls from scaffolds, ladders and roofs are the most common cause of fatal injuries among construction workers.
